messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([A-Za-z ]+,\s*)*[A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a group of 16 scholars. Amir is connected to Wim, Raj, Jing, and Reza. Wim is connected to Amir, Raj, Jing, and Eva. Raj is connected to Amir, Wim, Jing, and Wei. Jing is also connected to Amir, Wim, Raj, and Pam. Wei is connected to Nisha, Reza, Kim, and Raj. Nisha is connected to Wei, Reza, Kim, and Sara. Reza is connected to Amir, Kim, Nisha, and Wei. Kim is also connected to Wei, Nisha, Reza, and Moin. Ian is connected to Moin, Puja, Sara, and Matt. Moin is connected to Ian, Puja, Kim, and Sara. Puja is connected to Pari, Ian, Sara, and Moin. Sara is also connected to Ian, Moin, Puja, and Nisha. Pari is connected to Pam, Matt, Eva, and Puja. Pam is connected to Jing, Pari, Matt, and Eva. Matt is connected to Pari, Pam, Eva, and Ian. Eva is also connected to Pari, Pam, Matt, and Wim. You have been told that Moin is donating 50 books and Matt is donating 10 books. Now, from Amir what is the shortest path to the person with the maximum number of books? Remember that you can take books only from one person. Starting from Amir, please list the scholar names in order, including Amir, separated by commas.

The answer is Amir -> Kim -> Ian -> Sara -> Pari -> Pam 30 people like the challenge: 3 people love the game 1 people hate the challenge 2 people hate the game 2 people don't like the game (but can’t play) 23 people can’t play the game 2 people are willing to play
You can't give negative points. The amount earned by each player is not displayed anywhere on the app. You will need JavaScript and a little CSS3 to solve the problem.
The player must answer the question before the timer runs out, either by using numbers and operators, or by selecting the one true answer between the options. If the player decides to skip, the timer will not work.
In this game you start at square zero by default. Your task is to win as many as you can by answering the trivia questions correctly. There are two ways to win: either using your knowledge of mathematics, or by luck (this means, not being able to answer the question).
You and a team of friends play a trivia game, the rules are similar to the game "Hangman": if you do not provide the correct answer in 10 seconds, your sentence gets longer. At the end, the player that gives the more accurate and consistent answer will be declared the winner. Each friend has a chance of 1 out of n guesses to give the right answer. In each turn, each friend has to guess a letter by clicking on it, so that its length will be reduced (e.g., if the player types "ba", it will get 1 right letter correct, and the sentence would be "ban"). If the player does not select a right letter, or if the letter that he or she chose does not match any word in the puzzle, then the player will have to guess one more letter. Each letter typed by the player will be displayed in the same color for all friends, except for the one who knows the answer. At the end of the game, the player who has answered the most right questions will win the match.
When you play a game on the platform, you can only view your own statistics: how many points you have won the game and lost, how many moves you have made with the highest score. This week you have learned more and more new information about the game. You can now view the list of friends of a friend. This week you will learn
